text: Anyone have a good way to strip html whitespace?  <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/FtYVt5TCqt.png> results from <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/Upuk98effR.png> The only solutions I know of are to physically remove the indentation and such in the module markup, which is far from ideal, especially when they element starts having more attributes, classes, HubL variable content, etc. <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/ccB7pHrmU9.png> And the other way is to add a `{%- if true -%} {%- endif -%}` wrapper, which again looks messy and seems a bit unintuitive, and has to be followed directly after and before the opening and closing tags respectively. <https://cdn.vizality.com/u/bNTm3UdNmQ.png>
Is it possible to generate rss-feed from hubdb?
<@U7V9DQ31P> You might have an idea on this?
the only two ways I know of are either using the dashes like you mentioned or refrain from using line breaks where you need to limit the extra whitespace.
Reminder: Used to PHP and are looking to learn HubL? Hereâ€™s a comparison: <https://youtu.be/xKjozJNzWSk>

Can also do `{#- -#}` an alternative to the if statements.

You could also add an idea forum post for HubSpot to automatically minify HTML when not using `?hsDebug=true`
honestly I just wish all html would be minified

Can the blog_recent_posts function pull posts from a blog that's hosted on a different HubSpot account? I'm trying o do exactly that, and I've tried by using the blog_recent_posts function and also the rss_listing tag, and both seem to be pulling in the local blog instead. Is this a bug?
